channel.title: First login testscape
channel.description:
Ok, i got help for the first tim with the onscreen thing... lets see if this is as simple to,
I dont know why but whenever a new cahr logs into my server, they die and die and die...... well yea, buffer overflow....server lags off, were whatever makes you die on first login declared at cause i need to fix it

item.title: First login testscape
item.dc:creator: @Hiaburi Hiaburi
item.description:
@Hiaburi wrote:

i know it is, and oh i didnt think of that, so i just need to edit it, playerhandler im guessing?

i like the more rs like sources, i tried cheezescape but ive been working with testscape since it came out, so im jsut used to the way it works now
well that fixed the first 2 exceptions, but the last three just happend again…

Read full topic

item.title: First login testscape
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

No, testscape does that because by DEFAULT HP STARTS AT 0 AND TESTSCAPE IS A PEICE OF CRAP.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Hiaburi Hiaburi

ok so that should solve that, but i enver had that problem before and i never changed it, so do you know were testscape kills the new players at?

item.title: First login testscape
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

Yeah, that’s because outStream is NULL after they get dissconnected. Change sendFrame126 to this

public void sendFrame126(String s, int id) { if(outStream == null) return; outStream.createFrameVarSizeWord(126); outStream.writeString(s); outStream.writeWordA(id); outStream.endFrameVarSizeWord(); flushOutStream(); }

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Hiaburi Hiaburi
item.description:
@Hiaburi wrote:

give me one second i will post all the lines[br][size=1]Posted on: March 23, 2007, 02:36:38 AM[/size][hr]10988 client.java

	public void sendFrame126(String s, int id) {
		outStream.createFrameVarSizeWord(126); // this line
		outStream.writeString(s);
		outStream.writeWordA(id);
		outStream.endFrameVarSizeWord();
		flushOutStream();
	}

12564 client.java

 else {
			setSidebarInterface(0, 2423); //chop, slash, lunge, block
			sendFrame246(2424, 200, Weapon);
			sendFrame126(WeaponName, 2426);  // this line
		}

14059 client.java

sendMessage("The guards kick you out the way.");
teleportToX = 2790;
teleportToY = 10214;
}
//end of quest 1 - invisible armour - @@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@
SendWeapon((playerEquipment[playerWeapon]), GetItemName(playerEquipment[playerWeapon])); // this line

        updatePlayers();

154 playerhandler.java

		for(int i = 0; i < maxPlayers; i++)
		{
			if(players[i] == null || !players[i].isActive) continue;
			players[i].actionAmount--;
			players[i].preProcessing();
			while(players[i].process());  // this line
			players[i].postProcessing();
			players[i].getNextPlayerMovement();
			if(client.AutoSave == true)
			{

			npcHandler.process();

item.title: First login testscape
item.dc:creator: @Hiaburi Hiaburi
item.description:
@Hiaburi wrote:

ah i see, i was told to ad that along with -nowarn by some one before.
ok, the kick is not server wide, it seems to kick the people in order that they signed on.

ClientHandler: Client dracar1234 disconnected.
Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NullPointerException
        at client.sendFrame126(client.java:10988)
        at client.SendWeapon(client.java:12564)
        at client.process(client.java:14059)
        at PlayerHandler.process(PlayerHandler.java:154)
        at server.main(server.java:47)

Read full topic

item.title: First login testscape
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

If you use -g:none, you can’t tell the line which the error occured on, so I wouldn’t suggest it for any server source you’ve downloaded from this site.

Read full topic

let me produce the error real quick

at client.SendWeapon(Unknown Source)

at PlayerHandler.process(Unknown Source)
at server.main(Unknown Source)

item.title: First login testscape
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

You should read more about Java; the cause of that is that all array elements are initialized to 0 upon array constructification, and the server interprets that as UDIED().

Read full topic
